definition[0]: the worry, disappointment, or unhappiness you feel when something unpleasant happens
example[0]: The thought of leaving filled him with dismay.
example[1]: They stared at each other in dismay.
example[2]: I found to my dismay that I had left my notes behind.
definition[1]: to make someone feel worried, disappointed, and upset
example[3]: The poor election turnout dismayed politicians.
